name: paste-and-upload
description: Paste images and files from clipboard, upload it to a S3-compatible storage and generate a link in current file. The extension is powered by the new DocumentPasteEdit API, allowing to be run in browsers and remote environments.

paste-and-upload.s3.region.description: The region of the S3-compatible storage. Must be set.

paste-and-upload.s3.endpoint.description: The endpoint of the S3-compatible storage. Leave empty if you are using AWS S3.

paste-and-upload.s3.accessKeyId.description: The access key ID of the S3-compatible storage. Can be left empty if your bucket does not require authentication to upload files (Not recommended).

paste-and-upload.s3.secretAccessKey.description: The secret access key of the S3-compatible storage. Can be left empty if your bucket does not require authentication to upload files (Not recommended).

paste-and-upload.s3.bucket.description: The bucket of the S3-compatible storage. Must be set.

paste-and-upload.s3.prefix.description: The path prefix that will be used to store the files. For example, 'images/' will store the files in the 'images' folder.

paste-and-upload.s3.publicUrlBase.description: The base URL that will be used to generate the public URL of the files. For example, 'https://example.com/' will generate the URL 'https://example.com/image.png'. The path prefix should be manually added to the base URL, or handled by your reverse proxy.

paste-and-upload.fileSizeLimit.description: File size limit in bytes. Users will be prompted to confirm the upload if the file size exceeds this limit. Set to 0 to disable the limit.

scripts.pretest: yarn run compile-tests && yarn run compile && yarn run lint
